text:
Today we are visiting the central market in
Hoi An.

It is about seven thirty in the morning and
the place is just full of activity.

People are selling fresh vegetables and fruits,
so let's go see what we can find.

Waking up this morning has been one of the
best ideas we've done since we've come to

We've been treated to this market almost entirely
to ourselves.

We actually haven't noticed another foreigner
here yet.

One of the quirks of this market is that they
sell live chickens and ducks.

That is not something you see in the supermarket
everyday.

Here at the market you can find all kinds
of exotic fruits that are associated with

SE Asia such as papaya, mangosteen, rambutan,
dragon fruit.

From a birds eye view perspective it is just
a sea of conical hats.
It is too bad we forgot to bring ours today.
